poem:
**The Business of Progress**

In the conference room,  
they pivot back to black gold,  
a chorus of barrels singing,  
while the planet's sigh  
draws quieter beneath  
the hum of projections,  
and shareholders  
nod approvingly,  
ignoring the distant  
whispers of leaves,  
the muted glide  
of the silver fin,  
lost in the charts and graphs  
of an upward trend.
